title: Unable to Build Xyce Package | Configure has not found BLAS libraries
body:
# Issue Description
- I am trying to build Xyce simulator using spack using a custom spec file shown in the next section.
- It requires adms, and specific trilinos configuration which I have been able to able to build succesfully.
- However, when I am trying to build xyce, I get the following error:
```
....
     146    checking for library containing sqrt... -lm
     147    checking for library containing dcopy... no
     148    checking for library containing dgetrs... no
  >> 149    configure: error: Configure has not found BLAS libraries for your system.  Please install BLAS or provide appropriate -l and -L flags to LIBS and 
            LDFLAGS to allow configure to locate the dcopy function.
```
- I am providing the blas lib path using LDFLAGS but it is somehow ignored by the compiler.

# Steps to reproduce the issue
```console
spack install xyce
```
The spec file is shown below:
```
# Copyright 2013-2021 Lawrence Livermore National Security, LLC and other
# Spack Project Developers. See the top-level COPYRIGHT file for details.
#
# SPDX-License-Identifier: (Apache-2.0 OR MIT)

# ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
# If you submit this package back to Spack as a pull request,
# please first remove this boilerplate and all FIXME comments.
#
# This is a template package file for Spack.  We've put "FIXME"
# next to all the things you'll want to change. Once you've handled
# them, you can save this file and test your package like this:
#
#     spack install xyce
#
# You can edit this file again by typing:
#
#     spack edit xyce
#
# See the Spack documentation for more information on packaging.
# ----------------------------------------------------------------------------

from spack import *


class Xyce(AutotoolsPackage):
    """
    Xyce is a SPICE-compatible, high-performance analog circuit simulator,
    capable of solving extremely large circuit problems by supporting large-scale
    parallel computing platforms.
    """

    homepage = "https://github.com/Xyce/Xyce"
    url      = "https://github.com/Xyce/Xyce/archive/Release-7.2.0.tar.gz"
    # git      = "https://github.com/Xyce/Xyce.git"

    maintainers = ['rowhit']

    # supported versions
    # version('master', branch='master')
    version('7.2.0', sha256='cf49705278ecda46373784bb24925cb97f9017b6adff49e4416de146bdd6a4b5')
    # version('7.1.0', sha256='401e41bdf7db4a61e9382177ca123139960f888a3ed9f46264366db5e86c4ef4')

    # dependencies
    depends_on('autoconf', type='build')
    depends_on('automake', type='build')
    depends_on('bison')
    depends_on('flex')
    depends_on('fftw')
    depends_on('suite-sparse')
    depends_on('blas')
    depends_on('lapack')
    depends_on('libtool', type='build')
    depends_on('swig')
    depends_on('mpi')
    depends_on('boost')
    depends_on('adms')
    depends_on('xyce-trilinos')
    depends_on('automake')
    depends_on('autoconf')

    # def url_for_version(self, version):
    #     url = "https://github.com/Xyce/Xyce/archive/Release-{0}.tar.gz"
    #     return url.format(version.dashed)

    def autoreconf(self, spec, prefix):
        bash = which('bash')
        bash('./bootstrap')

    def configure_args(self):
        spec = self.spec

        args = [
            "ARCHDIR={}".format(spec['xyce-trilinos']),
            "--enable-mpi",
            "--enable-shared",
            "--enable-xyce-shareable",

            "CC={}".format(spec['mpi'].mpicc),
            "CFLAGS=-O3",

            "CXX={}".format(spec['mpi'].mpicxx),
            #"CXXFLAGS=-O3 -std=c++11",
            "CXXFLAGS=-O3",
            "CPPFLAGS=-I{} -I{} -I{}".format(
                spec['suite-sparse'].prefix.include,
                spec['blas'].prefix.include,
                spec['lapack'].prefix.include),
            "LDFLAGS=-L{} -L{}".format(
                spec['blas'].libs.directories[0],
                spec['lapack'].libs.directories[0]),
            "F77={}".format(spec['mpi'].mpif77),
            "FFLAGS=-O3"
        ]

        return args

```

# Information on your system
* **Spack:** 0.16.0-1151-f3f8a72bbd
* **Python:** 3.8.5
* **Platform:** linux-ubuntu20.04-zen
* **Concretizer:** original


# Additional information
- The spack-build-out.txt file is shown below
